item.title: Editrix add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "The truth will set you free. But not until it is finished with you." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Editrix add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Te Occidere Possunt Sed Te Edere Non Possunt Nefas Est" ("They can kill you, but the legalities of eating you are quite a bit dicier")." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Editrix add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "There's a kind of Ah-ha! Somebody at least for a moment feels about something or sees something the way that I do. It doesn't happen all the time. It's these brief flashes or flames, but I get that sometimes. I feel unalone—intellectually, emotionally, spiritually. I feel human and unalone and that I'm in a deep, significant conversation with another consciousness in fiction and poetry in a way that I don't with other art." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Editrix add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "Fiction’s about what it is to be a fucking human being." -- David Foster Wallace

item.title: Editrix add a quote by David Foster Wallace
item.description: "It’s a very American illness, the idea of giving yourself away entirely to the idea of working in order to achieve some sort of brass ring that usually involves people feeling some way about you – I mean, people wonder why we walk around feeling alienated and lonely and stressed out." -- David Foster Wallace
